column4: BRIEF-Ethan Allen Interiors Says Taking A Major Workforce Reduction Through Temporary Layoffs
column6: * TAKING A MAJOR WORKFORCE REDUCTION THROUGH TEMPORARY LAYOFFS
column7: * ETHAN ALLEN INTERIORS - WILL CONTINUE TO PAY ITS AFFECTED ASSOCIATES THROUGH APRIL 2, 2020
column8: * ETHAN ALLEN INTERIORS - TEMPORARY CLOSURE OF MOST OF CO’S MANUFACTURING FACILITIES, EFFECTIVE IMMEDIATELY
column9: * WILL REDUCE SALARIES OF ALL ASSOCIATES MAKING A SALARY OF $80,000 AND UP
column10: * ETHAN ALLEN INTERIORS - CO’S REGULAR QUARTERLY CASH DIVIDEND IS CURRENTLY BEING EVALUATED
column11: * ETHAN ALLEN INTERIORS - BORROWED ADDITIONAL $20 MILLION ON MARCH 30TH, BRINGING CASH AND INVESTMENTS ON HAND TO ABOUT $110 MILLION AS OF MARCH 31, 2020 Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:

column4: BRIEF-Ethan Allen Declares Regular Quarterly Cash Dividend, Increases Share Repurchase Authorization
column6: * REG-ETHAN ALLEN DECLARES REGULAR QUARTERLY CASH DIVIDEND AND INCREASES SHARE REPURCHASE AUTHORIZATION
column7: * INCREASED CURRENT SHARE REPURCHASE PROGRAM, INCREASING REMAINING SHARES AUTHORIZED FOR REPURCHASE TO THREE MILLION SHARES Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage: (Reuters.Briefs@thomsonreuters.com)

column4: BRIEF-Ethan Allen Interiors Sees Q3 Consolidated Net Delivered Sales $181.4 Million
column6: * EXPECTS CONSOLIDATED NET DELIVERED SALES FOR Q3 OF $181.4 MILLION, A 0.5% INCREASE OVER PRIOR YEAR PERIOD
column7: * Q3 WHOLESALE DELIVERED SALES INCREASED BY 7.3% TO $118.9 MILLION
column8: * QTRLY RETAIL DIVISION DELIVERED SALES WERE IMPACTED BY TIMING OF RECEIPT OF PRODUCTS, AND DECLINED 3.6% TO $136.9 MILLION
column9: * Q3 ADJUSTED DILUTED EARNINGS PER SHARE IS EXPECTED TO BE IN RANGE OF $0.10 TO $0.11
column10: * Q3 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $0.16, REVENUE VIEW $182.1 MILLION -- THOMSON REUTERS I/B/E/S
column11: * Q3 EARNINGS PER SHARE FORECAST REFLECTS IMPACT OF RISE IN MARKETING EXPENDITURES, DELAYED DELIVERY OF RETAIL BACKLOG, AMONG OTHERS
column12: * ETHAN ALLEN - Q3 EARNINGS PER SHARE FORECAST ALSO REFLECTS IMPACT OF RISE IN RAW MATERIALS COSTS, HIGHER INSURANCE COSTS, MANUFACTURING INEFFICIENCIES DUE TO GOVERNMENT CONTRACT STARTUP Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:
